source.author: Entwisle, T.J.; Bates, R.J.
source.title: Microtis
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Entwisle, T.J.; Bates, R.J. (1994). Microtis. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Labellum without calli, entire; lateral sepals spreading, not recurved in mature flowers
Labellum with calli, entire, undulate or incised; lateral sepals recurved or revolute in mature flowers
Flowers usually yellowish; labellum ovate to elliptic, lamina flat; lateral sepals very blunt, not hidden by labellum
Flowers green; labellum lamina more or less circular and concave; lateral sepals recurved, acute, hidden by labellum
Labellum more or less oblong, apex truncate, notched or bilobed, lamina with apical or subapical callus
Labellum more or less triangular, apex obtuse or acute, lamina with only basal calli (sometimes with a minute papillose cushion in apical half)
Flowers not distant; petals partly hidden within dorsal sepal; labellum less than half as long as ovary
Flowers distant; petals spreading below dorsal sepal; labellum two-thirds to as long as ovary
Labellum pendulous, strongly bilobed (with hook-like, decurved point between lobes); dorsal sepal with acute, upturned apex
Labellum pressed against ovary, shallowly notched; dorsal sepal with obtuse apex
